criteria.text: The focus (style) is visible
criteria.help: The focus is usually a ring around an interactive element, that shows what element is selected.

criteria.text: Buttons are focusable
criteria.help: All interactive elements should be reachable only using the 'tab' key

criteria.text: The focus is trapped inside the dialog
criteria.help: The focus should not leave the dialog. This means, all other interactive elements on the page are not reachable with the 'tab' key and are therefore outside of the taborder.

criteria.text: The dialog closes with the `esc` key
criteria.help: Upon pressing 'esc', the dialog should close. 'esc' is seen as the cancel option.

criteria.text: The focus returns to the calling button after closing or canceling the dialog with `esc`
criteria.help: To help with seamless navigation, the focus should return to the element that opened a dialog.

criteria.text: The `[x]` close button has alt-text, that is read with the screenreader
criteria.help: If you select the close button with tab

criteria.text: The content of the dialog is read upon opening
criteria.help: If a dialog opens, the text inside should automatically be read. A blind person otherwise can't know, that ther is a dialog open.

criteria.text: The header elements are focusable
The focus (style) is visible
The panel opens/closes with `space` or `enter` upon focus of a header element
Navigation between panel headers is possible with `tab`
Any hidden text is not read
The element with the tooltip is focusable
The focus (style) is visible
The tooltip is shown upon focus
The tooltip closes with the `esc` key
The tooltip is read upon focus of the element
